author: edsonalcala
content: Has anybody got any resource to run Beacon and validator clients in Raspberry devices?

author: ryg9705
content: <@!323945712674930688> I'm running lighthouse on my aarch64 dev boards as it's the easiest to install on non-amd64 architecutre. Just takes about an hour to compile but you can then just copy the binary to your other devices. Teku was also pretty easy to build. Prysm is a bit difficult, because you first need to get bazel to work on aarch64.

author: ryg9705
content: Lighthouse and Teku is pretty much just like installing on any other device.

author: nishant0
content:
<@!134118181710200833> you can alternatively just use our compiled binaries 
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/releases/download/v1.0.0-alpha.16/beacon-chain-v1.0.0-alpha.16-linux-arm64
it would save you the having to build both bazel and prysm

author: ryg9705
content: <@!476250636548308992> Perfect. Do you also have aarch64 Docker images on Google Container Registry? I also have a small bare metal kubernetes cluster that I would like to run them on.

author: nishant0
content: Ah unfotunately we do not have arm64 docker images yet

author: nishant0
content: there are some blockers to having that for now

author: prestonvanloon
content: We don't provide arm64 docker images and don't have a plan to provide them at this time <@!134118181710200833>. Are you running a bare metal k8s on raspberry pi? That's really cool! I think the best approach could this could be a really simple docker image that calls `./prysm.sh beacon-chain`, you can set the environment variable USE_PRYSM_VERSION to pin to a specific version. Or you could prepare the docker image with the compiled arm64 binaries. Let me know what you think

author: ryg9705
content: <@!399309815517544451> I have 5 Rock64's and a handful of ODROID boards in my cluster. Surprisingly easy to set up. Just need to use MetalLB as load balancer. I think copying the compiled binares into a docker images is the best approach. Thanks for that suggestion!
